security_audit.summary: This is a knowledge-based security skill containing legitimate penetration testing methodologies. It provides structured guidance for network reconnaissance without executing any code or accessing systems. The skill contains only educational content about security tools and techniques.

content.user_title: Master Network Reconnaissance with Expert Methodologies
content.value_statement: Network reconnaissance is critical for security assessments but requires systematic methodology. This skill provides structured reconnaissance techniques using industry-standard tools like nmap, gobuster, and enumeration utilities.
actual_capabilities: Provides layered reconnaissance strategies with 3 escalation levels
Includes specific command examples for nmap, gobuster, and enumeration tools
Offers structured output formats for JSON parsing
Contains service-specific enumeration techniques for SMB, FTP, SSH, and databases
limitations: Provides guidance only - no automatic execution
Requires manual implementation of suggested commands
Focused on network and web reconnaissance only
Assumes Kali Linux or similar penetration testing environment

use_cases.title: Penetration testing reconnaissance
use_cases.description: Systematically discover open ports, services, and potential vulnerabilities in target systems during authorized security assessments.

use_cases.title: Capture the flag enumeration
use_cases.description: Quickly identify attack vectors and hidden services in CTF challenges using proven reconnaissance methodologies.

use_cases.title: Learning reconnaissance techniques
use_cases.description: Understand proper reconnaissance workflow and tool usage through structured examples and best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Basic port scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a Layer 1 reconnaissance on IP 10.10.10.1. Start with a fast port scan to identify open services.

prompt_templates.title: Web enumeration
prompt_templates.prompt: Found HTTP on port 80. Apply the layered web enumeration strategy starting with gobuster using common.txt wordlist.

prompt_templates.title: Service fingerprinting
prompt_templates.prompt: Discovered ports 22, 80, 3306. Perform service version detection and script scanning on these services.

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive reconnaissance
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute complete reconnaissance methodology on target 10.10.10.50. Include all phases: port discovery, service detection, web enumeration, and service-specific enumeration.

output: Recommendations: Test file upload in /uploads, check WordPress version

best_practices: Always follow the layered approach - start quick, escalate only if needed
Save all command output for later reference and state updates
Use JSON output format when possible for easier parsing by automation
anti_patterns: Don't skip phases - complete reconnaissance before moving to exploitation
Avoid running all tools at maximum intensity immediately - wastes time
Never perform reconnaissance without proper authorization

faq.question: Which tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill covers nmap, gobuster, dirb, nikto, whatweb, enum4linux, and other standard reconnaissance tools.

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with Claude Code and provides command examples suitable for CLI-only environments.

faq.question: Can I use this for real penetration testing?
faq.answer: This skill provides educational guidance for authorized security assessments. Always obtain proper permission before testing.

faq.question: How long should reconnaissance take?
faq.answer: Layer 1 takes 1-5 minutes, Layer 2 takes 5-30 minutes. Adjust based on your time constraints and target environment.

faq.question: What if no services are found?
faq.answer: Escalate through all three layers. If still nothing, re-evaluate your approach or check network connectivity.

faq.question: Does this skill execute commands automatically?
faq.answer: No, this is a knowledge base that provides guidance. You must manually execute the suggested commands.
